tools: ESRI ArcGIS Desktop – Vector and raster data creation, spatial analysis, choropleth mapping, network analysis, interpolation, and hydrological modeling.
ArcGIS Pro – Advanced vector/raster workflows, geoprocessing automation, spatial modeling, and 3D analysis capabilities.
QGIS – Vector/raster data management, spatial analysis, geoprocessing tools, proximity analysis, overlay operations, terrain analysis, and multi-format data integration.
Global Mapper – High-precision digitization, spatial analysis, and multi-format data conversion for GIS workflows.

ERDAS Imagine – Digital image preprocessing (radiometric and atmospheric correction, image enhancement), geometric correction and orthorectification, supervised and unsupervised classification, accuracy assessment (achieving up to 0.97 Kappa accuracy in LULC mapping), and multi-temporal change detection.
ArcGIS Pro – AI-based supervised image classification using machine learning algorithms (SVM, Random Tree, Random Forest) with integrated accuracy assessment and validation.
QGIS – Semi-automatic LULC classification using SCP (Semi-Automatic Classification Plugin), LULC change detection, and future land use prediction using the MOLUSCE plugin.

Google Earth Engine – Cloud-based LULC mapping, AI-based classification (SVM, Random Forest), SAR data processing, wetland change detection, GeoAI modeling for biodiversity and ecosystem, and GeoAI modeling for Park Cooling Parameters.
IDRISI SELVA & TerrSet – LULC map generation, change analysis, and future LULC prediction using the LCM model, Biodiversity Analysis.

Green and Blue Space Cooling Analysis – GeoAI-based XGBoost model: Park Cooling Distance or Lmax (Gradient and Decay Method), Park Cooling Contribution, Park Cooling Area, Cooling Gradient, Cooling Efficiency.
Biodiversity and Ecosystem Analysis – GeoAI-based Random Forest modeling.
LULC Modeling – Support Vector Machine, XGBoost, Random Forest, and Random Tree on GEE and ArcGIS Pro.
